Html:
When trying to evaluate the string "3(410) I get this error: "missing EOF at '(' at line 1:1"

Obviously if I modify my input to read "3(4*10)" it works properly, but I'm not sure that I can rely on my users to understand what the EOF error message means in this case.

Is there a way, using the options or the EvaluateFunction or EvaluateParameter events to properly parse this input? I've triedg everything I could think of but cannot make it work.

Any help would be appreciated. Thanks.
